business.headline: Silver ETFs sink up to 15%, gold ETFs remain relatively steadySilver ETFs witnessed aggressive one-day selling, with losses ranging from over 10% to nearly 15% during morning trade. The fall was much steeper than what was seen in gold ETFs.

A slow reset, not a shock: What the EU-India FTA means for liquor companiesThe EU-India FTA is not an immediate disruption to India's domestic alcohol industry but a calibrated strategic shift that will gradually reshape competition, pushing domestic producers to evolve through premiumisation, enforcement-backed regulation, and long-term adaptability rather than relying on tariff protection.

Sensex falls 400 points: Are IT stocks down today, do investors need to panic?At around 10 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 448.57 points at 83,369.12. The NSE Nifty50 also slipped, falling 144.95 points to 25,631.05. The fall was close to half a percent, showing a clear pause after the recent rally.

Sensex, Nifty open lower amid IT stock worries; metal shares major laggardsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 225.69 points to 83,592.00, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 87.65 points to 25,688.35 as of 9:23 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will IT shares fall again on stock markets?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,820 points at around 7:54 am. This suggests that the Nifty 50 may open above Wednesday's closing level of 25,776.

We want to double our stores in India in next 2-3 years: Hugo Boss CEOIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, Hugo Boss CEO Daniel Grieder discusses the company's strategic focus on the Indian market.

Arvind Panagariya on why India's trade deals with US, EU could be bigger moment than 1991In an exclusive interview with India Today, Dr. Arvind Panagariya, Chairman of the 16th Finance Commission and former Vice-Chairman of NITI Aayog, shares his thoughts on the landmark India-US trade deal and more.

From policies to AI: How businesses and governments can deliver at scaleMohit Joshi and Kaan Terzioglu discussed the importance of long-term thinking, ethical practices, and digital solutions in building credibility with customers, governments, and societies.

Elon Musk becomes world's first person with $800 billion after SpaceX-xAI dealMusk is now $578 billion richer than Google co-founder Larry Page, the world's second-wealthiest person, who is estimated to be worth $281 billion.

Gold jumps nearly 4%, silver up 6%: Is the rally set to continue?At the time of writing, gold was priced at Rs 1,58,858, up 3.28% or Rs 5,049. Silver showed an even stronger recovery, trading at Rs 2,83,395, higher by 5.74% or Rs 15,380.

Sensex, Nifty end higher amid volatile trade; Infosys falls over 7%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 78.56 points higher at 83,817.69, while the NSE Nifty50 added 48.45 points to settle at 25,776. Most broader market indices also finished positive, even as intraday volatility spiked.

Infosys, TCS shares tumble amid global tech sell-off: Is the AI fear justified?Was today's slide in IT stocks a glimpse of the future or just market overreaction? For investors, the only question now is whether the AI threat is real or simply rattling nerves.

Why Hugo Boss sees India as a key growth market amid global slowdownHugo Boss currently has around 15 stores in India and plans to double that number over the next two to three years. According to its CEO, the brand is being well received by both men and women in the country.

Extended ITR deadline explained: Who can file till August 31 and who can'tFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman clarified this during her Budget speech, saying that only specific taxpayers would get extra time, while most individuals would continue to follow the existing deadline.

Why banks are using IVR checks for high-value UPI paymentsOne of the most common safety steps used today is IVR verification, where banks confirm a transaction through an automated phone call before money is transferred.

Global tech sell-off hits Indian IT stocks: Could this trigger more layoffs?AI has started influencing how the IT industry works and hires. Understanding today's developments helps IT professionals see where the real opportunities are and what adjustments may be needed over time.

Deepinder Goyal calls ex-employees back to Zomato, says I want you backAccording to Goyal, the company already has more than 400 employees who are currently in their second or third stint with the group.

Why Anthropic's new AI tools rattled Wall Street's tech giants, hit Indian IT stocksThe slide in IT stocks is not just about prices. It reflects the new uncertainty AI brings to global tech. Knowing what sparked it helps decode what lies ahead for the sector.

How buying gold on an app is pushing real gold prices higherIt is not just safe haven demand or industrial demand alone driving gold and silver prices higher. A quiet shift in how people buy gold and silver is changing real-world supply and prices.
Infosys, TCS sink up to 8%: Why are IT stocks falling today?A fresh AI development in the US set off a chain reaction that landed right on Dalal Street. This story helps you make sense of the chaos.

entertainment.headline: Telugu actor Eesha Rebba files complaint over obscene Instagram comments Actor Eesha Rebba filed a complaint at the Banjara Hills Police Station to report harassment after receiving obscene and abusive comments on Instagram amid promotional activities for her recent Telugu film.

No royalties, low pay, fear culture: Abhijeet Sawant on playback singing struggles Abhijeet Sawant, winner of Indian Idol season 1, has addressed persistent problems in the film music industry relating to singer pay and royalties. His comments follow Arijit Singh's recent announcement to step away from playback singing.

Anil Kapoor apologises to fan, re-shares Pukar post after forgetting to tag singers Anil Kapoor apologised after forgetting to tag singers in his Pukar anniversary post. His quick response and humility earned praise from fans and social media users alike.

Allu Sirish and Nayanika's yacht bash in Dubai sets stage for March wedding Allu Sirish and Nayanika hosted a pre-wedding celebration on a yacht in Dubai, attended by friends and family. Sophie Choudry shared pictures and videos capturing the festivities.

Never praised 'Vishwaguru': Naseeruddin Shah links university snub to political views Naseeruddin Shah said he was disinvited at the last minute from Mumbai University's Jashn-e-Urdu event and later falsely accused of refusing to attend. He linked the issue to his political criticism, citing "the Vishwaguru" he never praised.

Animal heads to Japan: Ranbir talks Raj Kapoor connection, plans visit with Raha Ahead of the Japan premiere of Animal, actor Ranbir Kapoor connected virtually with Japanese audiences. During a virtual interaction, he shared memories of his grandfather, legendary actor Raj Kapoor and expressed his hopes for the film's reception.
Siddhant Chaturvedi jokes aap kisi aur ki dulhan hain at Mrunal Thakur A playful on-stage comment by Siddhant Chaturvedi at a film event has set tongues wagging. Here's why everyone's talking.

Mirzapur: The Movie theatrical release date announced; details inside Mirzapur franchise makes its theatrical debut with a worldwide release this September. The film promises to expand the gritty crime drama universe with fan-favourite characters returning to the big screen.

Rashmika to pause AA22xA6 filming for wedding with Vijay Deverakonda: Report Rashmika Mandanna is set to take a break from filming AA22xA6, directed by Atlee and starring Allu Arjun, as she prepares for her reported wedding with Vijay Deverakonda later this month in Udaipur. An official announcement is expected.

Exclusive: Govinda's wife Ssunita Ahuja signs her first Bollywood film Actor Govinda's wife Ssunita Ahuja has signed her first Bollywood film with Balaji Motion Pictures. The yet-untitled project will mark Sunita's official acting debut, with sources confirming that she will be seen in a pivotal role.

Wait, since when did hypocrisy become the main plot in Splitsvilla X6? Splitsvilla X6 has unfolded as a chaotic spectacle marked by selective morality and biased rule enforcement, overshadowing its original theme of 'Pyaar vs Paisa'. The season reveals a troubling double standard where drama is encouraged at the cost of fairness and respect, leaving viewers questioning the integrity of the show.

Dhurandhar: The Revenge teaser soundtrack X Doja Cat confirmed? Details inside The makers confirmed on YouTube that the song AAAHH MEN! by Doja Cat is the official soundtrack for the teaser. Directed by Aditya Dhar and headlined by Ranveer Singh, the film is slated for release on March 19.

Film certification time slashed to 18 days with new online system, informs Ministry L Murugan, Minister of Information and Broadcasting said in Lok Sabha that the Central Board of Film Certification now averages 18 working days for feature film certification due to the Online Certificate System, significantly below the prescribed 48-day limit.

Bridgerton 4: Benedict may lead but footman John is the season's real diamond In Bridgerton Season 4, not all eyes are on leading man Benedict. As the series expands its focus beyond the ballroom, the subtle performance of footman John is emerging as a talking point.

Nick Jonas recalls premature birth of daughter Malti: She was purple… Nick Jonas shared details of the intense early days of daughter Malti's premature birth, six blood transfusions, and 12-hour hospital shifts. Here's the full story.

Arjun Kapoor's viral post exposes us: We knew, and we mocked anyway Arjun Kapoor's post about his mother opens up a larger conversation on grief, endurance, and what we, on the internet, choose to overlook.

Are Talwiinder and Disha Patani dating? Singer finally breaks silence Talwiinder has finally addressed the dating rumours with Disha Patani. Here's what he revealed about his feelings and the mysterious bond sparking social media frenzy.

Did you know Zayn Malik's new album Konnakol has Indian musical influence? Singer Zayn Malik is back with a fifth album that promises a bold new sound. Fans are already wondering what the mysterious title Konnakol really means. Read more to find out.

Ghooskhor Pandat title row: Mumbai advocate sends legal notice to Netflix, makers According to the notice, the title Ghooskhor Pandat is "per se offensive" and objectionable because it combines a term commonly associated with bribery and corruption with the word Pandit, which Dubey described as a historically respected cultural, religious, and intellectual identity.

general news.headline: Fiery showdown in Rajya Sabha day after PM Modi's Lok Sabha speech cancelled Live UpdatesThe fiery showdown in Rajya Sabha comes amid repeated disruptions and the controversy surrounding the cancellation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's scheduled address in the Lok Sabha on Wednesday.

Here's proof of our love for K-Pop: What Ghaziabad sisters wrote in suicide noteThe three sisters died after allegedly jumping from the ninth floor of their residential building in Ghaziabad. Police are investigating the circumstances surrounding the deaths, including their intense obsession with the Korean pop culture.

US-Russia nuclear treaty expires today. Will it lead to a new arms race?The only remaining nuclear treaty between the US and Russia expires today. It effectively spells a death knell for nearly three decades of nuclear control cooperation. What was the treaty? Will it lead to a new nuclear arms race? We delve into these questions in this article and explain it in 900 words.

Justice after 42 years: Court acquits 100-year-old man convicted for murderThe Allahabad High Court set aside the conviction of Dhaniram, who had been sentenced to life imprisonment by a sessions court in Hamirpur in 1984. His appeal against the conviction had remained pending before the High Court for over 40 years.

Never praised 'Vishwaguru': Naseeruddin Shah links university snub to political viewsNaseeruddin Shah said he was disinvited at the last minute from Mumbai University's Jashn-e-Urdu event and later falsely accused of refusing to attend. He linked the issue to his political criticism, citing "the Vishwaguru" he never praised.

New Delhi free to buy oil from any country: Russia after India-US trade dealIndia imports nearly 88% of its crude, with Russian oil emerging as a key source after 2022. Moscow said India is free to diversify, but replacing Russian volumes is not commercially simple.

Caught on camera: Delhi man thrashed, hit with brick for challenging molestersThe businessman was attacked for stopping a group of men allegedly molesting a woman in broad daylight. All four accused were arrested after a complaint was filed by the woman.

Poor judgement: Deepak Chopra breaks silence on mention in Epstein filesIndian-American and wellness guru Deepak Chopra has broken silence on his name's mention in the Jeffrey Epstein files, saying he regrets the email exchanges and that those reflected a poor judgement in tone.

Mumbai-Pune Expressway re-opens after 32 hours, jam remains as drivers fell asleepAfter a gas tanker carrying propylene overturned in Khandala Ghat, traffic stayed frozen for nearly 32 hours, with queues stretching 20–22 km and hundreds of commuters stranded overnight on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway.

Live: Lok Sabha passes Motion of Thanks without PM's addressParliament Session Live Updates: The Motion of Thanks on the President's Address will be passed in the Lok Sabha on Thursday without Prime Minister Narendra Modi replying to the debate, sources said, as repeated disruptions triggered by Rahul Gandhi's speech continued to stall proceedings in the Lower House. The Lok Sabha has remained paralysed since Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi referred to an unpublished memoir of former Army chief General Manoj Naravane, drawing sharp objections from Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Home Minister Amit Shah. According to sources, Prime Minister Modi is likely to reply to the Motion of Thanks in the Rajya Sabha today, where the discussion has concluded without disruption. The government is planning to get the Motion of Thanks passed in both Houses on the same day, even if the Lok Sabha debate does not resume normally. Sources also said that discussion on the Union Budget is expected to begin in the Lok Sabha today, even as uncertainty hangs over the smooth conduct of business amid the ongoing standoff. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for the latest updates on the ongoing Budget Session.

Yunus's rush to ink secretive deal with US has Bangladesh exporters worriedThe interim setup of Muhammad Yunus is set to sign a tariff deal with the US. However, the non-disclosure agreement that keeps details shrouded in mystery has got Bangladeshi business leaders concerned. Then there is a bigger question. Is it legal for the unelected Yunus regime to ink a deal even as an elected government could come to office in weeks time?

UP woman kills father-in-law, lover records video of her slitting his throatPolice said the accused called Subachchan Rajbhar out on the pretext of drinking liquor, gagged him and slit his throat. The accused even recorded the video of the crime on their mobile phone.

K-dramas, K-pop, kimchi: Why Korean culture won India's heartKorean pop culture has surged in India since 2022, spanning dramas, music, food, fashion, and language learning. From family-centric storytelling to soft masculinity and female-focused narratives, Korean content has struck a deep emotional chord across age groups, becoming one of the most influential global cultural forces shaping Indian audiences today.

Epstein's ex invited him home when daughter was 15: She'll have 5 friends overJeffrey Epstein had already served jail time in Florida in a trafficking case and was registered as a sex offender when he exchanged emails with Eva Andersson-Dubin, his on and off girlfriend throughout the 1980s.

What is Anthropic Claude Cowork, tool that hit Infosys, TCS, other SaaS companies?Infosys, TCS and other SaaS companies lost hundreds of billions of dollars in market value just like that. Reason? It was AI.

UK asks Air India why Dreamliner took off from London with possible faulty fuel switchThe UK Civil Aviation Authority has asked Air India to explain a potential fuel control switch fault on a Boeing Dreamliner after a London departure. This follows safety concerns linked to last year's deadly crash and may lead to regulatory action.

Before WaPo layoffs, Bezos pulled the plug on space tourism programBlue Origin confirmed it will suspend New Shepard flights for at least two years, effectively grounding its most visible commercial product.

Won't be bullied, will wait out Trump term for trade deal, Doval told RubioThe Modi government had conveyed to the US in early September 2025 that it was willing to wait out the Trump presidential term if needed on the India-US trade deal. This tough line was conveyed to US Secretary of State Marco Rubio by India NSA Ajit Doval, according to a Bloomberg report. The report on the meeting and the mellowing down of Trump and his aides after that gives a new perspective to the debate over the India-US trade deal.

Are WaPo layoffs the beginning of the end for full-time newsroom roles?Mass layoffs at The Washington Post signal a significant shift in the global media landscape, highlighting the steady decline of traditional newsroom employment and the rapid rise of freelance journalism, gig-based media work, and independent digital reporting as alternative career pathways for journalists.

Not one Muslim? Indian businessman comes under racial attack at Riyadh exhibitionIn the video, the man appears to mock the firm for its religious identity, sneering that it has "not even one Muslim." The controversy gained traction after a UAE-based political analyst shared the video online, condemning the incident as "blatant racism."

Arjun Kapoor's viral post exposes us: We knew, and we mocked anywayArjun Kapoor's post about his mother opens up a larger conversation on grief, endurance, and what we, on the internet, choose to overlook.

Woman sends sealed package through Rapido. What the delivery boy found shocked himA woman used Rapido's porter service to send a sealed package. However, what the delivery boy found in the package when he reached the drop location left him confused and shocked.

Shashi Tharoor's son Ishaan laid off as Washington Post fires one-third of staffWashington Post has laid off nearly one-third of its staff, including the New Delhi bureau chief, closing key sections including sports and foreign. The cuts raise concerns about the future of global journalism at one of America's leading newspapers.

Video: Terrifying moments inside Mumbai lift as gas-filled balloons explodeA routine lift ride in Mumbai's Goregaon West turned dangerous after a hydrogen gas–filled balloon burst inside an elevator, triggering a brief fire that left two people with minor injuries.

sports.headline: Beyond Suryakumar Yadav. List of Indian-origin captains in T20 World Cup T20 World Cup 2026: It is not just the Indian team that will have a captain from India in the T20 World Cup. The mega event on Indian and Sri Lankan soil is set to witness several Indian-origin players leading their respective associate teams.

Tilak Varma gets angry at Arshdeep Singh: Don't take videos without permission T20 World Cup: India batter Tilak Varma got angry at Arshdeep Singh at the end of the team's warm-up game against South Africa. In the dressing room, Tilak told Arshdeep to not film him without permission.

Has Samson lost opener's battle to Kishan? Aakash Chopra gives his verdict T20 World Cup: Aakash Chopra said that Ishan Kishan cemented his place for the opener's slot with his 53-run knock against South Africa in the warm-up match on Wednesday in Navi Mumbai.

I quite like it: Hussain backs Bangladesh, Pakistan over World Cup boycott Nasser Hussain has lambasted the ICC and the BCCI over the ongoing uncertainty in the cricketing world. Nasser says that he quite likes the fact that the board stood up for their players.

Delhi look to break final curse, aim for 2024 revenge in battle of best friends WPL 2026 Final, RCB vs DC Preview: In the battle of best friends, Jemimah Rodrigues' Delhi Capitals will be up against Smriti Mandhana's Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the summit clash on Thursday in Vadodara.

Time to stand up to BCCI, 400 million now on one side: Ex-Pak cricket chief T20 World Cup 2026: Speaking to India Today, former Pakistan Cricket Board chief Najam Sethi said Pakistan is now standing up to BCCI by announcing the boycott of their game against India. Sethi said the ICC is run by people in the BCCI and Pakistan are willing to let go off short-term financial gains to end the bullying of the global cricket body.

Sanju Samson's fate sealed? Job's not finished with T20 World Cup 2026 in sight With India's T20 plans taking shape, Sanju Samson faces a reduced role ahead of the 2026 World Cup. Staying ready, and being used wisely, may decide his future.

Rs 9 crore for ISL, Rs 100 crore for Kerala: How low has Indian football sunk The ISL has its broadcast deal, but the numbers tell a harsher story. Now, valued below regional leagues and nowhere near cricket, Indian football's top tier has fallen from grace.
T20 World Cup: Pakistan PM confirms no change in India boycott stance Pakistan Prime Minister Shahbaz Sharif confirmed that Pakistan will not play against India in the T20 World Cup 2026 group stage.

Could Goa break unsettle RCB? Smriti Mandhana opens up ahead of WPL final WPL 2026: Smriti Mandhana said that Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) are fresh for the final against Delhi Capitals (DC) after they spent their one-week break enjoying in Goa.

IND vs SA, warm-up: Ishan edges Samson, Tilak back as India ready to defend crown IND vs SA, T20 World Cup Warm-ups: India's only warm-up turned into a statement as Ishan Kishan sealed the opener role, Tilak Varma returned in style, and the bowlers controlled the chase to down South Africa by 30 runs.

India among six bidders to host football's Asian Cup 2031India is among six nations bidding to host the AFC Asian Cup 2031, the Asian Football Confederation confirmed, as the country renews its push to stage the continent's top football tournament with full government backing.

PCB face heavy financial losses if they refuse to play India at T20 World Cup: ReportThe Pakistan Cricket Board risks significant financial losses if penalised by the ICC for not playing India in the T20 World Cup. This could lead to serious financial challenges amid ongoing stadium upgrades and revenue dependencies.

IND-PAK match can happen if Bangladesh are reinstated at T20 World Cup: Ex-PCB chiefFormer chief of the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB), Najam Sethi believes that there is still a chance that the India-Pakistan game can take place if Bangladesh are reinstated with their games being held in Sri Lanka.

Aaron George's 115 helps India chase a record 311 vs Afghanistan to reach finalICC U19 World Cup: India scripted a remarkable chase as opener Aaron George's heroic century powered them past a record 311 against Afghanistan in the second semi-final, setting up a title clash with England.

Ishan Kishan's blitz as opener vs South Africa puts Samson under serious pressureIND vs SA, T20 World Cup: Ishan Kishan went berserk in the warm-up match against South Africa at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai, scoring 53 off 20 balls with seven sixes before retiring out.

Fitness is getting better and I will be back soon: Rishabh PantIndia's wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant on Tuesday said he is recovering well from his injury and is hopeful of returning to competitive cricket at the earliest.

From JJ Smuts to Wayne Madsen: Italy's T20 World Cup stars you can't missT20 World Cup 2026: Italy are set to make their maiden appearance on the global stage. Led by Wayne Madsen, the Azzurri face a stern challenge in a tough group that also features England and the West Indies.

Mirabai Chanu shatters three national records at Weightlifting ChampionshipsIndian weightlifting star Mirabai Chanu continued her record-breaking run, rewriting the national marks with a commanding display at the National Weightlifting Championships on Wednesday.

U19 World Cup: Vaibhav steps up under pressure with 33-ball 68 in semi-finalIND-U19 vs AFG-U19: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi delivered a fearless counterattack under pressure, smashing 68 off just 33 balls to give India a flying start in their chase against Afghanistan in the Under-19 World Cup 2026 semi-final at the Harare Sports Club on Wednesday.

IND vs SA warmups Highlights: India beat South Africa by 30 runs in Navi MumbaiIND vs SA T20 World Cup Warm-Up Match: India beat South Africa by 30 runs at the Dr DY Patil Sports Academy in Navi Mumbai to win the warm-up match on Wednesday.

Rohit, Kohli for ODI World Cup? Dhoni tells Agarkar to focus on fitness, not ageFormer India captain MS Dhoni has given his verdict that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli should be considered for the ODI World Cup in 2027. Dhoni's viewers have found a lot of takers among fans.

Sachin Tendulkar rallies Mumbai with timely pep talk before Ranji Trophy quarterfinalSachin Tendulkar shared insights on pressure and preparation with the Mumbai squad ahead of their Ranji Trophy quarterfinal against Karnataka, offering timely motivation before the knockout clash.

Inspired by Hardik Pandya, Bas de Leede aims for 'big man moments' in World CupNetherlands beat South Africa in the ODI World Cup hosted in India back in 2023. As they return for yet another world tournament, all-rounder Bas de Leede hopes to inspire them to consistency in big events.

Ishan Kishan jumps 32 spots, Saim Ayub becomes No. 1 T20I all-rounderIndia's Ishan Kishan has climbed 32 places to No.32 in the latest ICC Men's T20I batter rankings following his performances in the home series against New Zealand. Meanwhile, Pakistan's Saim Ayub has moved to the top of the T20I all-rounder rankings.

MS Dhoni rules out commentary stint, reveals why he avoids using phoneFormer India captain MS Dhoni has all but ruled out a move to the commentary box, describing the popular post-retirement role as a demanding craft that requires a delicate balance and a sharp command of statistics, something he admits does not come naturally to him.

Pep Guardiola vows to speak up for victims of global conflicts ahead of World CupPep Guardiola made an impassioned plea to "protect human life" in an emotional news conference, during which the Manchester City head coach referenced the recent deaths of Renee Good and Alex Pretti in Minneapolis.

IND v SA, T20 World Cup warm-up: Now or never for Sanju Samson?IND vs SA, T20 World Cup warm-up match: Even champions have doubts to settle. India's warm-up against South Africa doubles as a selection trial, with Sanju Samson's opening spot under threat from the in-form Ishan Kishan this week.

IND U19 vs AFG U19 Highlights: India hammer Afghanistan to set up final vs EnglandIndia (IND) vs Afghanistan (AFG) Highlights, U19 World Cup 2026 semifinal: India beat Afghanistan by seven wickets on Wednesday at the Harare Sports Club to qualify for the final, where they will face England.

Boycott India, forget Super 8s: Why rain is Pakistan's biggest foe in ColomboT20 World Cup: Pakistan have decided to boycott their group stage match against India in Colombo. But can they afford to waste a game when two of their other matches are threatened by rain?

T20 World Cup: Pakistan can brag about series win, but don't count Australia outPakistan have every right to enjoy a 3-0 sweep of Australia so close to a T20 World Cup, but the context tempers the celebration. Australia travelled with a depleted squad and used the series as preparation, and history shows they have often stumbled before global tournaments, only to find their best form when it matters most.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
